# Ramsay Health Care - Company Profile

## Executive Summary

Ramsay Health Care Limited (ASX: RHC) is one of the world's largest private healthcare providers, operating approximately 530 facilities across 9 countries. Founded in 1964 in Sydney, Australia, the company has grown from a single 16-bed psychiatric hospital to a global healthcare network employing over 77,000 staff and treating 8.5 million patients annually.

---

## 1. Company Overview

### Headquarters
- **Address:** Level 18, 126 Phillip Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
- **Founded:** 1964
- **Founder:** Paul Ramsay AO
- **ASX Listing:** 1997 (originally listed 1987, privatized 1992, re-listed 1997)

### Market Capitalization & Financials (FY2024)
| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Market Cap | ~A$5.5 billion |
| Annual Revenue | A$16.66 billion |
| Revenue Growth | 11.3% YoY |
| Employees | 77,000-90,000 globally |
| Ticker | ASX: RHC |

### Global Footprint
Ramsay operates in **9 countries**:
- Australia (headquarters)
- United Kingdom
- France
- Sweden
- Norway
- Denmark
- Italy
- Malaysia (divested 2023)
- Indonesia (divested 2023)

### History & Growth Milestones

| Year | Milestone |
|------|-----------|
| 1964 | Paul Ramsay founds company; opens Warrina House (16-bed psychiatric hospital) in Sydney |
| 1978 | Opens Baringa Private Hospital, Coffs Harbour |
| 1979 | Opens Albury Wodonga Private Hospital |
| 1987 | IPO on ASX (market cap A$53M) |
| 1992 | Company privatized |
| 1997 | Re-listed on ASX |
| 2004 | Acquires Benchmark Health Care Group |
| 2005 | Acquires Affinity Health Care (A$1.428B) - adds 51 hospitals |
| 2007 | UK expansion - acquires Capio UK operations (£193M) |
| 2010 | European entry - acquires 57% of Proclif (France) |
| 2013 | Asia JV with Sime Darby |
| 2014 | Acquires Générale de Santé, France (€545M); Paul Ramsay passes, leaves A$3B to Paul Ramsay Foundation |
| 2018 | Acquires Capio AB Sweden (SEK 8.2B/€788M) |
| 2021 | Acquires Elysium Healthcare UK (£775M) |
| 2023 | Divests Asian operations (Malaysia/Indonesia) for A$1.9B |
| 2024 | Leadership transition - Natalie Davis appointed CEO |

---

## 2. Geographic Operations

### Australia - Ramsay Australia
| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Hospitals & Facilities | 76 |
| Employees | 35,000+ |
| Patients/Year | 1+ million |
| Market Position | #1 private hospital operator in Australia |

**Facility Types:**
- 43 full-service private hospitals (acute care)
- 8 day surgery/surgical centers
- 14 mental health clinics
- 3 rehabilitation centers

**Key Locations by State:**
- **NSW:** Westmead Private, North Shore Private, St George Private, Berkeley Vale Private
- **Queensland:** Greenslopes Private, Sunshine Coast University Private, John Flynn Private, St Andrew's Ipswich Private
- **Victoria:** Peninsula Private Hospital
- Regional presence across major cities and regional centers

---

### United Kingdom - Ramsay UK & Elysium Healthcare

#### Ramsay UK (Acute Care)
| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Acute Hospitals | 34 |
| Day Procedure Centers | Included in above |
| Sterile Service Hubs | 3 |
| Employees | 7,500+ |
| Consultants | 3,000+ |
| Patients/Year | 200,000+ |
| NHS Revenue Share | ~80% of UK revenue |

#### Elysium Healthcare (Mental Health) - Acquired 2022
| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Sites | 72 |
| Beds | ~2,000 |
| Employees | 6,000 |
| Market Position | 3rd largest UK private mental health provider |

**Elysium Service Streams:**
- Mental health and wellbeing
- Learning disabilities and autism
- Neurological services
- Children and education

---

### France & Europe - Ramsay Santé

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Total Facilities | 465 |
| Countries | 5 (France, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Italy) |
| Employees | 38,000 |
| Practitioners | 9,300 |
| Patients/Year | 12+ million |

#### France Operations
| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Hospitals/Clinics | 163 |
| French Market Position | #1 private hospital operator |
| French Employees | 26,200 |
| Births/Year | 29,000 |
| Patient Reach | 1 in 9 French patients |

**France Market Leadership:**
- #1 private player in orthopaedic surgery
- #1 private player in ophthalmic surgery
- #1 private player in cardiac surgery
- #1 private player in oncology
- #1 in dialysis (all France)

#### Nordics Operations

**Sweden:**
| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Employees | 10,300 |
| Key Asset | St. Göran's Hospital (Stockholm) - contract renewed through 2026+ |
| Digital Platform | 800,000+ customers (15% of adult population) |
| Market Position | Largest private healthcare operator (via Capio) |

**Norway:**
| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Employees | 760 |
| Recent Growth | 3 new primary care centers (public partnership model) |

**Denmark:**
| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Employees | 700 |

**Italy:**
| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Employees | 200 |
| Facility | 93-bed hospital |

---

### Asia - Ramsay Sime Darby Healthcare (DIVESTED 2023)

**Historical Joint Venture (2013-2023):**
- Partnership with Malaysian conglomerate Sime Darby
- Sold to Columbia Asia Healthcare (TPG/Hong Leong) for A$1.9B (5.7B ringgit)

**Former Operations:**

*Malaysia (3 facilities):*
- Subang Jaya Medical Centre
- Ara Damansara Medical Centre
- ParkCity Medical Centre
- Ramsay Sime Darby Healthcare College (Setia Alam)

*Indonesia (3 hospitals):*
- RS Premier Jatinegara
- RS Premier Bintaro
- RS Premier Surabaya

*Hong Kong:*
- The Central Surgery (day surgery center in CBD)

| Total Beds | 25,000+ |
| Annual Patients | 8.5 million+ |
| Employees | 77,000-90,000 |
| Revenue (FY24) | A$16.66 billion |
| Countries | 9 (7 active post-Asia divestment) |

### Breakdown by Region

| Region | Facilities | Beds | Employees |
|--------|------------|------|-----------|
| Australia | 76 | N/A | 35,000 |
| UK (Acute) | 34 | N/A | 7,500 |
| UK (Elysium) | 72 | 2,000 | 6,000 |
| Ramsay Santé | 465 | N/A | 38,000 |

---

## 4. Services & Specialties

### Core Service Lines

**Surgical Services:**
- Complex surgery (inpatient)
- Day surgery/ambulatory care
- Orthopaedic surgery
- Cardiac surgery
- Oncology/cancer surgery
- Ophthalmic surgery
- Bariatric surgery
- Plastic/reconstructive surgery
- General surgery
- Dental surgery

**Mental Health & Psychiatric Care:**
- Inpatient psychiatric care
- Community-based mental health
- Anxiety and depression treatment
- Addiction treatment
- Learning disabilities and autism (UK)
- Children and adolescent mental health
- Secure mental health facilities (low/medium)

**Rehabilitation:**
- Inpatient rehabilitation
- Outpatient rehabilitation
- Physiotherapy
- Hydrotherapy
- Occupational therapy
- Neurological rehabilitation

**Other Services:**
- Primary care (Nordics focus)
- Maternity services
- Emergency services (private)
- Diagnostic services
- Dialysis
- Telehealth/virtual care
- Care at home/community services

### Day Surgery vs Inpatient Mix
- Strong focus on efficient day surgery/ambulatory care model
- Full-service inpatient capabilities for complex cases
- Growing outpatient and community-based care

---

## 5. Leadership

### Executive Team (2024-2025)

| Role | Name | Since |
|------|------|-------|
| **Managing Director & Group CEO** | Natalie Davis | December 2024 |
| **Former CEO** | Craig McNally | 2017-2024 (retired June 2025) |
| **Group Executive - Technology & Digital** | Dr. John Doulis | November 2024 |
| **Chief Health & Strategy Officer** | Dr. Brindan Suresh | Current |
| **Chief People & Culture Officer** | Colleen Harris | 2018 |

### Board of Directors

| Role | Name | Notes |
|------|------|-------|
| **Chairman** | David Thodey AO | Since November 2023; former CEO of Telstra; Chairman of Xero |
| **Non-Executive Director** | Michael Siddle | Founding Director (since 1975); former Chair (2014-2023) |

### Recent Leadership Changes

**CEO Transition (2024-2025):**
- Craig McNally announced retirement after 37 years with company (joined 1988, CEO since 2017)
- Natalie Davis appointed CEO-elect October 2024, became MD & Group CEO December 2024

**Natalie Davis Background:**
- Former Managing Director, Woolworths Supermarkets Australia (130,000 employees, 1,000 sites)
- 15-year partner at McKinsey & Co (Australia/NZ and UK offices)
- MBA from INSEAD France
- BCom and LLB (Hons) from University of Sydney

### Dr. John Doulis - Group Executive, Technology & Digital

**Appointment:** November 2024

**Role:** Leads Ramsay's global digital and technology strategy, driving innovation to support clinical teams and enhance patient care.

**Background:**
- Former VP of Data Services and Innovation at HCA Healthcare (US/UK)
- Led digital transformation and innovation team at HCA Healthcare
- Former Assistant Vice Chancellor for Health Affairs and COO of Informatics Center at Vanderbilt University
- M.B.B.S./M.D. from Monash University, Melbourne
- 20+ years experience in healthcare information systems
- Private equity/venture capital experience: funded 15+ portfolio companies
- Former CEO of Digichart, Inc. and Informatics Corporation of America (both successful exits)
- Physician Executive with clinical and technology expertise

**Replaced:** Dr. Rachna Gandhi (former Group Chief Transformation, Digital, Data and AI Officer - 4 years tenure)

**Strategic Focus:** Ramsay is undertaking a 10-year digital transformation including AI tools to streamline workflows and reduce administrative burdens.

### Board Chair Transition (2023)
- Michael Siddle served as Chair for 9 years (non-independent)
- David Thodey served as Lead Independent Director (2020-2023)
- Thodey became Chair effective November 29, 2023
- Siddle remains on board as Non-Executive Director
